title: Data Platform Administrator
description: A Data Platform Administrator is a technical specialist responsible for managing, supporting, and optimizing the core data platforms used across an organization. Their primary goal is to ensure these platforms run smoothly, securely, and efficiently to enable analytics, business intelligence (BI), and data science efforts for all users, including analysts, developers, and data scientists. Think of a Data Platform Administrator as the 'data infrastructure gatekeeper.' They ensure that essential tools and databases like Power BI, Azure Synapse, Snowflake, SQL Server, or Tableau are always operational, secure, and performant. This role is crucial in modern data-driven organizations, blending IT operations, governance, and deep BI platform knowledge to build a scalable, secure, and performant BI ecosystem while enabling self-service analytics across departments.

details.label: Platform Support & Maintenance
items: Manage and monitor BI tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau, Qlik)
Maintain performance and uptime, including installation, configuration, patching, and upgrades of database servers and instances
Handle configurations and troubleshoot system-level issues

details.label: User & Access Management
items: Set up and control role-based access (RBAC, Row-Level Security - RLS)
Support user provisioning and license management
Enforce data governance policies and manage user access, roles, and permissions

details.label: Security & Compliance
items: Ensure data platform compliance with internal and external regulations (e.g., HIPAA, GDPR)
Manage authentication and authorization (e.g., Azure AD, OAuth, SSO)
Implement security measures to protect sensitive data

details.label: Performance Optimization
items: Monitor resource consumption and optimize capacity
Help improve query performance, optimize indexes, and reduce load times for dashboards and reports
Fine-tune datasets and dataflows for efficiency

details.label: Collaboration & Enablement
items: Act as a liaison between IT, data teams, and business units
Support self-service analytics users with documentation, training, and troubleshooting
Assist developers with database design and query optimization

details.label: Monitoring & Incident Response
items: Set up alerts and monitoring tools (e.g., Azure Monitor, Power BI Admin Portal) to continuously track database health and performance
Resolve issues related to slow dashboards, failed refreshes, or platform errors promptly
Implement and manage robust backup strategies and ensure data recovery

details.label: Capacity Planning
items: Forecasting future resource needs (storage, CPU, memory) based on growth trends and planning for scalability
